00025         litm_envelope * _stack[LITM_POOL_SIZE];   //LIFO stack

00027         int _stack_initialized = 0; //FALSE
00028         int _top_stack = 0;
00029         int _created   = 0;
00030         int _recycled  = 0;
00031         int _returned  = 0;

00035 /**
00036  * Recyles an ``envelope`` by either:
00037  * - putting it on a stack for later recall
00038  * - destroying it if there is no more place on the stack
00039  *
00040  * NOTE: it is the responsibility of the client of this
00041  *       module to dispose of properly of the internal
00042  *       structure (ie. the ``msg`` member) of the
00043  *       ``envelope`` **before** using this recycling facility.
00044  *
00045  */
00046         void
00047 __litm_pool_recycle( litm_envelope *envlp ) {
00048 
00049         pthread_mutex_lock( &_pool_mutex );
00050 
00051         //can we recycle this one?
00052         if ( _top_stack + 1 == LITM_POOL_SIZE ) {
00053                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__litm_pool_recycle: destroying envelope [%x]", envlp );
00054                 __litm_pool_destroy( envlp );
00055 
00056         } else {
00057                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__litm_pool_recycle: recycling envelope [%x]", envlp );
00058                 _top_stack ++;
00059                 _stack[_top_stack] = envlp;
00060 
00061                 // statistics
00062                 _recycled ++;
00063         }
00064 
00065         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_pool_mutex );
00066 
00067 }//

00070 /**
00071  * Retrieves an ``envelope`` from either:
00072  * - the stack if one is available
00073  * - the heap
00074  *
00075  * Either case, the ``envelope`` is initialized
00076  * before returning it to the client.
00077  *
00078  */
00079 
00080         litm_envelope *
00081 __litm_pool_get(void) {
00082 
00083         pthread_mutex_lock( &_pool_mutex );
00084 
00085 
00086         // first time around?
00087         if (0==_stack_initialized) {
00088                 _stack_initialized = 1;
00089 
00090                 int i;
00091                 for(i=0;i<LITM_POOL_SIZE;i++)
00092                         _stack[i] = NULL;
00093         }//==============================
00094 
00095         litm_envelope *e;
00096 
00097 
00098         // do we have a spare?
00099         e = _stack[ _top_stack ];
00100         if (NULL!=e) {
00101 
00102                 _stack[_top_stack] = NULL;
00103                 __litm_pool_clean( e );
00104 
00105                 // statistics...
00106                 _returned ++;
00107 
00108                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__litm_pool_get: returning recycled envelope [%x]", e );
00109 
00110                 if (0!=_top_stack)
00111                         _top_stack-- ;
00112 
00113         } else {
00114 
00115                 // prepare a new one
00116                 e = malloc(sizeof(litm_envelope));
00117                 if (NULL!=e) {
00118 
00119                         // prepare the envelope
00120                         __litm_pool_clean( e );
00121 
00122                         // statistics...
00123                         _created ++ ;
00124 
00125                         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__litm_pool_get: returning new envelope [%x]", e );
00126                 }
00127 
00128         }
00129 
00130         pthread_mutex_unlock( &_pool_mutex );
00131         return e;
00132 }//

00135 /**
00136  * Destroys an ``envelope`` ie. just use free()
00137  *
00138  * A client of this module **must** dispose of
00139  * the internal structure of the ``envelope``
00140  * (ie. the ``msg`` member) before using this function.
00141  *
00142  */
00143         void
00144 __litm_pool_destroy( litm_envelope *envlp ) {
00145 
00146         if (NULL==envlp) {
00147                 DEBUG_LOG( LOG_ERR, "__litm_pool_destroy: NULL envelope");
00148                 return;
00149         }
00150         DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "__litm_pool_destroy: envelope [%x]", envlp );
00151 
00152         free( envlp );
00153 
00154 }//
